business.headline: Ripple CEO claims US SEC to drop appeal against crypto firmRipple CEO, the company behind XRP, announced on X that the US Securities and Exchange Commission will drop its appeal against Ripple Labs.
Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Fed announcementUS stocks showed marginal gains on Wednesday morning as Wall Street waits for the Federal Reserve's announcement.

US markets rise ahead of key Fed interest rate decisionAt the opening bell, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 84.73 points to 41,666.04. The S&P 500 gained 18.29 points, reaching 5,632.95, while the Nasdaq Composite climbed 84.20 points to 17,588.32.
Government to continue footing the bill for UPI payments under Rs 2,000The scheme covers transactions up to Rs 2,000 and will be in place for one year, from April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025.
India's first Trump-branded office project to be built in Pune. Check detailsOver the past decade, India has emerged as the largest international market for Trump-branded real estate.

Sensex, Nifty extend positive streak, but IT and FMCG stocks limit market gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 147.79 points to settle at 75,449.05, while the NSE Nifty50 added 73.30 points to close at 22,907.60.

REC shares rise after board clears 4th interim dividend for FY25. Check detailsREC Dividend: The company announced a dividend payout of Rs 3.6 per share, taking the total dividend declared so far in FY25 to Rs 15.4 per share.

Zomato shares surge over 4% as rally continues for 2nd day. What next?At 12:50 pm, shares of Zomato were up 4.12% to Rs 227.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). It may be noted that Zomato shares are rising despite the possibility that it could face an old insolvency plea.

PhysicsWallah IPO: Edtech firm files for Rs 4,600 crore public listingPhysicsWallah IPO: The edtech company has taken the confidential pre-filing route, a method that allows companies to submit their IPO documents to the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) without making financial details public immediately.

SAIL shares jump 4% today as steel stocks gain. Should you buy?SAIL shares gained 4% during the intraday trading session, following a broad-based rally in steel stock prices. Read to find out if the company's stock is likely to gain further.

Missed Rs 5,000 SIP in top Nifty stocks 5 years ago? Returns may surprise youDespite the recent correction, a systematic investment plan (SIP) in top Nifty50 stocks over the past five years would have still delivered strong returns.

TCS, Infosys, HCLTech: Why major IT stocks are falling todayShares of TCS and Infosys dropped 2%, while other IT names like HCLTech, Tech Mahindra, LTIMindtree, and Coforge also traded in the red. The Nifty IT index, which had been gaining for the last three sessions, was the worst-performing sectoral index in morning trade.

entertainment.headline: John Wick Ballerina trailer: Ana de Armas faces off Keanu ReevesThe second trailer of the highly anticipated John Wick spin-off, Ballerina, is here. And it promises loads of action and thrill.

Esha Deol on link-up rumours with Ajay Devgn: That was so weirdEsha Deol discussed past link-up rumours, including those with Ajay Devgn. She said it was weird and said their bond was more about respect and admiration for each other.

Actor Jonathan Majors wants to come back to Marvel, play Kang the Conqueror againActor Jonathan Majors is open to coming back to the world of Marvel movies again. Majors had been largely boycotted by the industry after his domestic abuse allegations.

Actor Parvathy on her role in Ullozhukku: I feel empowered because of AnjuDuring a recent interview, Malayalam actor Parvathy Thiruvothu shared her experience of filming for the role of Anju in the film Ullozhukku, for which she was nominated in the Best Supporting Actress category at the Critics' Choice Awards 2025.

Karma trailer: Shin Min-ah, Kim Hae-soo are at the centre of web of liesNetflix unveils Karma, a gripping Korean drama interweaving crime and fate. Starring a stellar cast, the series will explore deep connection between six different individuals and hidden truths.

Director-animator Shigeki Awai, man behind Naruto and One Piece, dies at 71Shigeki Awai, a legendary animator and director known for his extensive contributions to anime, died at the age of 71. Hideaki Matsuoka and Tsutomu Ohno paid tribute to him.

Elvish Yadav trolled for age-shaming Ankita Lokhande: Will you play Alia's mother?YouTuber Elvish Yadav recently faced online criticism after he openly age-shamed actor Ankita Lokhande. A video from a show where Yadav served the host has gone viral.

Mohanlal's Lucifer entry scene inspired by Rajinikanth: Prithviraj SukumaranMalayalam actor-director Prithviraj Sukumaran, who has been busy promoting his upcoming film L2: Empuraan, recently revealed that he took inspiration from Rajinikanth to design the entry scene of Mohanlal in the 2019 blockbuster film, Lucifer.

Composer Thaman on why Game Changer songs weren't popular: Lacked hook stepsDuring a recent interview, music composer Thaman opened up about his experience making music for Shankar's Game Changer, which starred Ram Charan and Kiara Advani. The film received negative reviews.
Director accused of stealing $11M from Netflix for a show that never aired Netflix had initially paid about $44 million to purchase an unfinished show called White Horse from Rinsch

Deepika Padukone is 'figuring out' how to return to work without mother's guiltActor Deepika Padukone recently spoke about her daughter Dua and how she is still figuring out between motherhood and work. The actor added how motherhood has influenced the kind of roles and movies she will pick now.

Sky Force on OTT: When and where to watch the Akshay Kumar, Veer Pahariya filmSky Force, featuring Akshay Kumar and Veer Pahariya, is set to stream on Prime Video from March 21. The film, inspired by true events, explores themes of camaraderie, sacrifice, and patriotism.

Meet Amrapali Shindhe, Bengaluru artiste who brought Kannada soul to LollapaloozaAmrapali Shindhe, a Bengaluru-based artiste, made a significant impact at Lollapalooza 2025 by performing in multiple languages, including Kannada, amid a predominantly English and Hindi lineup. Her performance was not just about music but a statement of cultural pride and linguistic representation.

Param Singh on Ghum Hai...: Thought I might not be able to pull off Dr NeilActor Param Singh returned to television with a new role in Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin, marking a shift from his usual intense characters to the calm and composed persona of Dr Neil. In an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, he spoke about his initial nervousness and excitement about the opportunity and his focus on performing with honesty.

Anurag Kashyap 'frustrated' by 'morally corrupt' Netflix India, praises AdolescenceAnurag Kashyap has openly criticised Netflix's approach towards Indian content, calling it hypocritical. He praised the British series Adolescence, expressing envy over its daring storytelling.

Fe3O4 FORWARD album review: NMIXX's most ambitious release yetNMIXX pushes boundaries with their latest EP Fe3O4 FORWARD. Featuring a mix of genres and a collaboration with Indian choreographer Paramdeep Singh, the album showcases the group's evolution and daring creativity.

Sylvester Stallone's Tulsa King renewed for third seasonTulsa King fans rejoice as the hit crime drama gets the green light for a third season. The series, featuring Sylvester Stallone, has captivated with its gripping storyline and stellar cast.

Kanye West hits back at Playboi Carti's request to collaborate with daughter NorthRapper Kanye West was displeased with fellow rapper Playboi Carti's request to collaborate with his daughter, North West. He voiced his disapproval and reaffirmed his parental authority in a series of posts on X.

Kim Soo-hyun releases new statement on Kim Sae-ron row, denies any wrongdoingKorean star Kim Soo-hyun's team has released a new statement amid the ongoing controversy regarding his alleged involvement in actor Kim Sae-ron's death.

general news.headline: Farmers clash with Punjab cops, Jagjit Dallewal detained, protest sites razedSeveral farmers clashed with Punjab Police in Mohali while heading towards the protest sites of Khanauri and Shambhu borders. The Punjab Police, meanwhile, began dismantling tents by using bulldozers at the sites.

Hang her: Parents of Meerut woman who killed husband, hid body in cement drumThe father of the Meerut woman, who along with her lover, are accused of killing her husband and hiding his chopped body in a cement-filled drum, said she could not live without drugs and wanted to get rid of him.

After Putin, Trump speaks to Zelenskyy: Calls aimed to align Russia, Ukraine needsUS President Donald Trump described his call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "very good," following his discussions with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday.

IndiaToday.in's Sibu Tripathi, 3 other India Today journalists win Ramnath Goenka awardFour journalists from India Today received the Ramnath Goenka Award for journalism. Awardees include Sibu Tripathi for Joshimath reporting, Mridulika Jha for migration stories, Ashutosh Mishra for Manipur violence coverage, and Siddhant Mohan for 'The Kerala Story'.
Instagram says rubbing raw ginger can cure acne. Do dermatologists agree?Rubbing raw ginger directly on your skin isn't exactly a glow-up move – it could make things worse.

Hamas must give up power or Israel will take over Gaza: Israeli envoy Reuven AzarIsrael's Ambassador to India Reuven Azar said Israel had been waiting for a "long time" for Hamas to release the remaining hostages. He justified the military pressure on the Palestinian group to achieve a diplomatic solution to end the war.

US Supreme Court likely to review 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana's extradition pleaThe US Supreme Court is expected to review Tahawwur Rana's plea seeking a stay on his extradition to India. Judges will consider the application during a private conference on April 4, 2025. Rana's earlier review petition was rejected on March 6 by Justice Kagan, after which he filed a fresh plea for consideration by the Chief Justice.

US faces housing crisis. Why Elon Musk's DOGE is to blameThe US is staring at a housing crisis after Elon Musk's DOGE halted federal housing projects, cutting $30 million in grants, worsening affordability, and stalling 1,000+ programs.
Ghost Aurangzeb and move onHow do we deal with a man who died three centuries ago, but won't stop kicking?

Indian Green Card holders face deportation risk: Their rights and recourseGreen Card holders, including Indians, are facing never-before-seen scrutiny as the Trump administration walks the talk on citizenship, immigration and deportation. What are the rights of American Green Card holders, and what legal recourse do they have if they are threatened with deportation?

Ageless Sunil Chhetri shines as India maul Maldives 3-0 in friendlySunil Chhetri marked his international return with India's 3-0 win over Maldives, contributing to a dominant performance and showing signs of his old brilliance.

India calls for sustained humanitarian aid, hostages' release after Gaza bombingIndia expressed concern over the situation in Gaza, where deadly Israeli airstrikes killed over 400 people, and said the supply of humanitarian assistance to the people there should be sustained.
Demand rises for Punch, Exter micro SUVs! Find out the reasonsThe micro SUVs are witnessing high sales in India. We discuss the reasons for the handsome performance.

Chahal complied with divorce consent terms: High Court on Rs 4.75 crore alimonyThe Bombay High Court overturned a family court decision that denied the request to waive the statutory cooling-off period for the divorce of cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma. It directed the family court to decide the divorce petition by Thursday, March 20.

1 foreigner killed, 4 injured in Israeli strike on UN headquarter: Gaza ministryThe Israeli military denied targeting the UN compound in Deir al-Balah, stating it had struck a Hamas site in northern Gaza where it said preparations for firing into Israeli territory were detected. Gaza's health ministry reported that one foreign national was killed and four others wounded in the strike on the UN headquarters.

Nagpur riots mastermind Fahim Khan arrested, caught on camera spreading rumoursPolice have named Fahim Khan as the mastermind of the Nagpur violence, alleging that his inflammatory speech triggered the clashes, leaving several injured and sparking large-scale unrest.

Pixel 9a launched in India: Top specs, key features and moreGoogle has finally introduced its much-awaited Google Pixel 9a smartphone in India today. Here is a detailed look at the phone's top specifications, features, and everything else you need to know about the new budget Pixel.

Did CIA have a role in John Kennedy's murder? Explosive details in JFK filesJFK Files: Former US President John Kennedy was assassinated in 1963 as his motorcade was passing through Dallas. The JFK files released by the Trump administration indicate that the CIA might have neglected red flags.

Sunita Williams's space marathon ends: Back home after 286 daysSunita Williams return: The astronauts, part of the Crew-9 mission, ended their spaceflight as they splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean having braved the challenging re-entry through Earth's atmosphere.

Will leave Rahul Gandhi red-faced: BJP as Shashi Tharoor praises PM Modi againPraising PM Modi for his diplomatic strategies for the second time in a month, Shashi Tharoor admitted he was wrong in opposing India's stand on the Ukraine war.

Watch: Dolphins are the surprise welcome crew for Sunita WilliamsDolphins greeted the Crew-9 astronauts as they splashed down in the Gulf Coast of Florida after a 17-hour-long journey from space. The Crew-9 mission includes Nasa astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who have been in space for nine months.

Woman kills husband with lover's help, hides chopped up body in cement-filled drumA Meerut woman, Muskan Rastogi, and her lover Sahil were arrested for murdering her husband, Saurabh Rajput, chopping off his body, and hiding it in a cement-filled drum.

Indians deported, but Trump fields India-born lawyer to argue deportation ActAmid the executive-versus-judiciary battle in the US over deportations, the Donald Trump administration has fielded an India-born advocate to defend the use of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to deport illegal immigrants. Abhishek Kambli is a top official at the Department of Justice and grew up in a working-class family of immigrant Indians.

Aurangzeb not relevant today: RSS's big remark after Nagpur violence, tomb rowNagpur violence: Over 30 people were injured in the Nagpur clashes that broke out between two communities after right-wing outfits held a protest demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb.

sports.headline: Kabaddi's global body declares World Cup in UK 'unauthorised'The International Kabaddi Federation has declared that the World Cup being held in London is not an "authorised" event and asked the sport's Indian apex body to take action against the 'Indian' team that is participating in the tournament.

NBA: Mavericks struggle with injury crisis, risk falling below NBA roster limitThe Dallas Mavericks are facing serious injury crises, leaving the team dangerously close to violating the NBA roster requirements.

Not chasing elusive 300: Shubman Gill firm on GT's brand in IPL 2025Gujarat Titans are not chasing after the 300-run mark like some of the other teams in the Indian Premier League, said captain Shubman Gill ahead of the new season.

LaVar Ball gets emotional as he opens up about leg amputationAmerican Businessman LaVar Ball, the father of NBA stars Lonzo and LaMelo Ball, spoke on his recent right leg amputation due to complications from diabetes.

The IPL story, Part 1: Power, politics, and cricket in its origin sagaThe Indian Premier League's origin story is one of power, politics, and ambition, driven by Lalit Modi's vision. From political maneuvering to the league's explosive rise, it set the stage for a saga of success and scandal.

IPL captains' meet: Saliva ban on agenda, BCCI leaves decision to skippersIPL 2025: The Board of Control for Cricket in India has allowed the captains of the 10 teams to discuss and decide if the saliva ban should be lifted. Cricketers have been banned from using saliva to maintain the shine of the ball since Covid-19 pandemic.

NBA: Stephen Curry is exhausted, says Steve Kerr as back injury raises concernGolden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry is battling with both fatigue and a back injury that raises concern for the Warriors.

Sunil Narine hints at rekindling love affair with opener's slotKKR talisman Sunil Narine wants to open the innings for his franchise once again. Speaking ahead of the opener, Narine has hoped that he would open alongside Quinton de Kock.

Chennai Super Kings IPL 2025 Complete Schedule: Fixtures, Venues, Match DatesChennai Super Kings IPL 2025 Full Schedule, CSK Squad: The Ruturaj Gaikwad-led team finished 5th in the last season's competition. Will they be able to better their position with a revamped squad?

MS Dhoni and I would cancel ad shoots to join CSK camp early: Suresh RainaIPL 2025: Suresh Raina highlighted how MS Dhoni had begun training for the IPL 2025 season as early as February, recalling their pre-season routines from his own time as a Super Kings player. Raina backed Dhoni's helicopters to land as frequently as ever in the new season.

Cricketers have been banned from using saliva to maintain the shine of the ball since Covid-19 pandemic.

MS Dhoni and I would cancel ad shoots to join CSK camp early: Suresh RainaIPL 2025: Suresh Raina highlighted how MS Dhoni had begun training for the IPL 2025 season as early as February, recalling their pre-season routines from his own time as a Super Kings player. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
